title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 80-1.1 - Findings of fact
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 80-1.1 - Findings of fact

State Regulations

The Industrial Commissioner finds that the flammability
standards set forth in this Part are needed for the protection of the public
against the unreasonable risk of the occurrence of fire leading to death, personal injury or significant property damage in the use of wearing apparel, fabrics, related materials and interior furnishings. The Industrial

Commissioner therefore finds that good cause exists for making this Part
effective April 27, 1973, except as otherwise provided herein, and that such
earlier effective date is in the public interest, as provided in section
503
of the

General Business Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
80-1.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
